__e: Yeah, and this, this one here is actually three generations of my family standing just out front, so.
Generations of my people fought and died under exile. Praying for the day when we could seek the path without recrimination.
There will be generations because of what you did.
You could cut a line of throats with the best blade ever made from now until your grandchildren died, and not spill half the blood a gun could in a day.
It was not too long ago we faced a similarly impossible task... and yet, on that day, despite the odds we finally ended generations of oppression and struggle by securing victory over Ba'als fleet.

But as a country, I don't think we've ever been ready to make the admission that we have steamrolled through entire communities and multiple generations when you think about things like slavery and Jim Crow, and all the other systems of oppression that have led us to where we are today.
12 generations ago when we returned, we found no sign of their existence.
Because generations ago, that hate and misplaced anger was part of our beliefs.
Dear brethren, we have an opportunity for the first time in generations in this country for peace and prosperity.
And you will. Five generations of Rikers have worked hard to make this city great.
Four generations have played this single game for every 450 years.
